00066 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC
00067 #define sched_malloc(size)              rt_malloc((size))
00068 #define sched_free(adr)                 rt_free((adr))
00069 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN
00070 #define sched_mem_init()
00071 #define sched_mem_end()
00072 #else  /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00073 #define sched_mem_init() \
00074         { if(rt_mem_init() != 0) { \
00075                 printk("Failed to allocate memory for task stack(s)\n"); \
00076                 return(-ENOMEM); \
00077         } }
00078 #define sched_mem_end()                 rt_mem_end()
00079 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC_BUILTIN */
00080 #define call_exit_handlers(task)                __call_exit_handlers(task)
00081 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2) __set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00082 #else  /* !CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */
00083 #define sched_malloc(size)      kmalloc((size), GFP_KERNEL)
00084 #define sched_free(adr)         kfree((adr))
00085 #define sched_mem_init()
00086 #define sched_mem_end()
00087 #define call_exit_handlers(task)
00088 #define set_exit_handler(task, fun, arg1, arg2)
00089 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_MALLOC */

00091 #define RT_SEM_MAGIC 0xaabcdeff
00092 
00093 #define SEM_ERR (0xFfff)
00094 
00095 #define MSG_ERR ((RT_TASK *)0xFfff)

00097 #define NOTHING ((void *)0)
00098 
00099 #define SOMETHING ((void *)1)

00101 #define SEMHLF 0x0000FFFF
00102 #define RPCHLF 0xFFFF0000
00103 #define RPCINC 0x00010000

00113 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00114 #define rt_time_h (rt_smp_time_h[cpuid & sqilter])
00115 #define oneshot_timer (rt_smp_oneshot_timer[cpuid & sqilter])
00116 #define rt_linux_task (rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid])
00117 #else
00118 #define rt_time_h (rt_smp_time_h[0])
00119 #define oneshot_timer (rt_smp_oneshot_timer[0])
00120 #define rt_linux_task (rt_smp_linux_task[0])

00125 extern unsigned long sqilter;
00126 
00127 #define SCHED_IPI     RTAI_3_IPI
00128 #define SCHED_VECTOR  RTAI_3_VECTOR
00129 
00130 static inline void send_sched_ipi(unsigned long dest)
00131 {
00132 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00133         unsigned long flags;
00134         arti_hw_lock(flags);
00135 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00136         apic_wait_icr_idle();
00137         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR2, SET_APIC_DEST_FIELD(dest));
00138         apic_write_around(APIC_ICR, APIC_DEST_LOGICAL | SCHED_VECTOR);
00139 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS
00140         arti_hw_unlock(flags);
00141 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_ADEOS */
00142 }
00143 
00144 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap) \
00145 do { \
00146         if (sqilter) { \
00147                 if (schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00148         } else { \
00149                 rt_schedule(); \
00150         } \
00151 } while (0)
00152 
00153 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap) \
00154 do { \
00155         if (sqilter && schedmap) send_sched_ipi(schedmap); \
00156         rt_schedule(); \
00157 } while (0)
00158 
00159 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid) \
00160         do { \
00161                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00162                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00163                 } else { \
00164                         rt_schedule(); \
00165                 } \
00166         } while (0)
00167 
00168 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid) \
00169         { \
00170                 if (((task)->runnable_on_cpus != (cpuid)) && sqilter) { \
00171                         send_sched_ipi(1 << (task)->runnable_on_cpus); \
00172                 } \
00173                 rt_schedule(); \
00174         }
00175 
00176 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00177 
00178 #define send_sched_ipi(dest)
00179 
00180 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP_BOTH(schedmap)  rt_schedule()
00181 
00182 #define RT_SCHEDULE_MAP(schedmap)       rt_schedule()
00183 
00184 #define RT_SCHEDULE(task, cpuid)        rt_schedule()
00185 
00186 #define RT_SCHEDULE_BOTH(task, cpuid)   rt_schedule()
00187 
00188 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00189 
00190 #define BASE_SOFT_PRIORITY 1000000000
00191 
00192 #define TASK_HARDREALTIME  TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE
00193 
00194 static inline void enq_ready_edf_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00195 {
00196         RT_TASK *task;
00197 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00198         task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00199 #else
00200         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00201 #endif
00202         while (task->policy < 0 && ready_task->period >= task->period) {
00203                 task = task->rnext;
00204         }
00205         task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00206         ready_task->rnext = task;
00207 }
00208 
00209 #define MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ (2 << 6)
00210 
00211 struct klist_t { volatile int srq, in, out; void *task[MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ]; };
00212 extern struct klist_t wake_up_srq;
00213 
00214 static inline void enq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task)
00215 {
00216         RT_TASK *task;
00217         if (ready_task->is_hard || (ready_task->lnxtsk)->state != TASK_HARDREALTIME) {
00218 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00219                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[ready_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].rnext;
00220 #else
00221                 task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].rnext;
00222 #endif
00223                 while (ready_task->priority >= task->priority) {
00224                         if ((task = task->rnext)->priority < 0) break;
00225                 }
00226                 task->rprev = (ready_task->rprev = task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task;
00227                 ready_task->rnext = task;
00228         } else {
00229                 wake_up_srq.task[wake_up_srq.in] = ready_task->lnxtsk;
00230                 wake_up_srq.in = (wake_up_srq.in + 1) & (MAX_WAKEUP_SRQ - 1);
00231                 rt_pend_linux_srq(wake_up_srq.srq);
00232         }
00233 }
00234 
00235 static inline int renq_ready_task(RT_TASK *ready_task, int priority)
00236 {
00237         int retval;
00238         if ((retval = ready_task->priority != priority)) {
00239                 ready_task->priority = priority;
00240                 if (ready_task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00241                         (ready_task->rprev)->rnext = ready_task->rnext;
00242                         (ready_task->rnext)->rprev = ready_task->rprev;
00243                         enq_ready_task(ready_task);
00244                 }
00245         }
00246         return retval;
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline int renq_current(RT_TASK *rt_current, int priority)
00250 {
00251         int retval;
00252         if ((retval = rt_current->priority != priority)) {
00253                 rt_current->priority = priority;
00254                 (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00255                 (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00256                 enq_ready_task(rt_current);
00257         }
00258         return retval;
00259 }
00260 
00261 static inline void rem_ready_task(RT_TASK *task)
00262 {
00263         if (task->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00264                 if (!task->is_hard) {
00265                         struct task_struct *proc;
00266                         (proc = task->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00267                         proc->rt_priority = (2*BASE_SOFT_PRIORITY - 1) - task->priority;
00268                 }
00269                 (task->rprev)->rnext = task->rnext;
00270                 (task->rnext)->rprev = task->rprev;
00271         }
00272 }
00273 
00274 static inline void rem_ready_current(RT_TASK *rt_current)
00275 {
00276         if (!rt_current->is_hard) {
00277                 struct task_struct *proc;
00278                 (proc = rt_current->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00279                 proc->rt_priority = (2*BASE_SOFT_PRIORITY - 1) - rt_current->priority;
00280         }
00281         (rt_current->rprev)->rnext = rt_current->rnext;
00282         (rt_current->rnext)->rprev = rt_current->rprev;
00283 }
00284 
00285 static inline void enq_timed_task(RT_TASK *timed_task)
00286 {
00287         RT_TASK *task;
00288         if (!timed_task->is_hard) {
00289                 (timed_task->lnxtsk)->state = TASK_HARDREALTIME;
00290         }
00291 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00292         task = rt_smp_linux_task[timed_task->runnable_on_cpus & sqilter].tnext;
00293 #else
00294         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00295 #endif
00296         while (timed_task->resume_time > task->resume_time) {
00297                 task = task->tnext;
00298         }
00299         task->tprev = (timed_task->tprev = task->tprev)->tnext = timed_task;
00300         timed_task->tnext = task;
00301 }
00302 
00303 static inline void wake_up_timed_tasks(int cpuid)
00304 {
00305         RT_TASK *task;
00306 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00307         task = rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid = cpuid & sqilter].tnext;
00308 #else
00309         task = rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext;
00310 #endif
00311         while (task->resume_time <= rt_time_h) {
00312                 if ((task->state &= ~(RT_SCHED_DELAYED | RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE | RT_SCHED_RECEIVE | RT_SCHED_SEND | RT_SCHED_RPC | RT_SCHED_RETURN | RT_SCHED_MBXSUSP)) == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00313                         if (task->policy < 0) {
00314                                 enq_ready_edf_task(task);
00315                         } else {
00316                                 enq_ready_task(task);
00317                         }
00318                 }
00319                 task = task->tnext;
00320         }
00321 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00322         rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid].tnext = task;
00323         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[cpuid];
00324 #else
00325         rt_smp_linux_task[0].tnext = task;
00326         task->tprev = &rt_smp_linux_task[0];
00327 #endif
00328 }
00329 
00330 static inline void rem_timed_task(RT_TASK *task)
00331 {
00332         if ((task->state & RT_SCHED_DELAYED)) {
00333                 (task->tprev)->tnext = task->tnext;
00334                 (task->tnext)->tprev = task->tprev;
00335         }
00336 }
00337 
00338 static inline RTIME get_time(void)
00339 {
00340 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00341         if (sqilter) {
00342                 int cpuid;
00343                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[cpuid = hard_cpu_id()] ? rdtsc() : rt_smp_times[cpuid].tick_time;
00344         } else {
00345                 return rt_smp_oneshot_timer[0] ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00346         }
00347 #else
00348         return oneshot_timer ? rdtsc(): rt_times.tick_time;
00349 #endif
00350 }
00351 
00352 static inline void enqueue_blocked(RT_TASK *task, QUEUE *queue, int qtype)
00353 {
00354         QUEUE *q;
00355         task->blocked_on = (q = queue);
00356         if (!qtype) {
00357                 while ((q = q->next) != queue && (q->task)->priority <= task->priority);
00358         }
00359         q->prev = (task->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(task->queue);
00360         task->queue.next = q;
00361 }
00362 
00363 
00364 static inline void dequeue_blocked(RT_TASK *task)
00365 {
00366         task->prio_passed_to     = NOTHING;
00367         (task->queue.prev)->next = task->queue.next;
00368         (task->queue.next)->prev = task->queue.prev;
00369         task->blocked_on         = NOTHING;
00370 }
00371 
00372 static __volatile__ inline unsigned long pass_prio(RT_TASK *to, RT_TASK *from)
00373 {
00374         QUEUE *q;
00375 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00376         unsigned long schedmap;
00377         schedmap = 0;
00378 #endif
00379         from->prio_passed_to = to;
00380         while (to && to->priority > from->priority) {
00381                 to->priority = from->priority;
00382                 if (to->state == RT_SCHED_READY) {
00383                         (to->rprev)->rnext = to->rnext;
00384                         (to->rnext)->rprev = to->rprev;
00385                         enq_ready_task(to);
00386 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00387                         set_bit(to->runnable_on_cpus & 0x1F, &schedmap);
00388 #endif
00389                 } else if ((q = to->blocked_on) && !((to->state & RT_SCHED_SEMAPHORE) &&
00390  ((SEM *)q)->qtype)) {
00391                         (to->queue.prev)->next = to->queue.next;
00392                         (to->queue.next)->prev = to->queue.prev;
00393                         while ((q = q->next) != to->blocked_on && (q->task)->priority <= to->priority);
00394                         q->prev = (to->queue.prev = q->prev)->next  = &(to->queue);
00395                         to->queue.next = q;
00396                 }
00397                 to = to->prio_passed_to;
00398         }
00399 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00400         return schedmap;
00401 #else
00402         return 0;
00403 #endif
00404 }
00405 
00406 static inline RT_TASK *_rt_whoami(void)
00407 {
00408 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00409         RT_TASK *rt_current;
00410         unsigned long flags;
00411         flags = rt_global_save_flags_and_cli();
00412         rt_current = RT_CURRENT;
00413         rt_global_restore_flags(flags);
00414         return rt_current;
00415 #else
00416         return rt_smp_current[0];
00417 #endif
00418 }
00419 
00420 static inline void __call_exit_handlers(RT_TASK *task)
00421 {
00422         XHDL *pt, *tmp;
00423 
00424         pt = task->ExitHook; // Initialise ExitHook in rt_task_init()
00425         while ( pt ) {
00426                 (*pt->fun) (pt->arg1, pt->arg2);
00427                 tmp = pt;
00428                 pt  = pt->nxt;
00429                 rt_free(tmp);
00430         }
00431         task->ExitHook = 0;
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline XHDL *__set_exit_handler(RT_TASK *task, void (*fun) (void *, int), void *arg1, int arg2)
00435 {
00436         XHDL *p;
00437 
00438         // exit handler functions are automatically executed at terminattion time by rt_task_delete()
00439         // in the reverse order they were created (like C++ destructors behave).
00440         if (task->magic != RT_TASK_MAGIC) return 0;
00441         if (!(p = (XHDL *) rt_malloc (sizeof(XHDL)))) return 0;
00442         p->fun  = fun;
00443         p->arg1 = arg1;
00444         p->arg2 = arg2;
00445         p->nxt  = task->ExitHook;
00446         return (task->ExitHook = p);
00447 }
